channel.title: Help with my preload
channel.description:
hi, im developing a loading screen to work with Opera, safari and older versions of IE and ff so it can preload any images meaning i can have a rolover with the right effect, because the opacity doesnt work in these browsers
the only probleme is i downloaded IE6 but because i have IE7 the cookies arent working properly, if anyone has IE6 please tell me hat happens when you try navigate my site
http://onlyonerule.pwnds.info/
thanks

item.title: Help with my preload
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:8, topic:128177”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=178798.msg1637555#msg1637555 date=1185806170]
yea i know those errors are there, but waht i want to know is if it preloads everytime you try visit a different page, or not

thx
[/quote]

perfect!

No, it loaded once when I first visited the page. no more loading after that.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my preload
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

It works fine. But it says there are some errors. Bio page: Picture doesn’t show up and a Syntax error on line 103.;
Events page: Same as before well…except for picture part; Guestbook: Same as before

Using the top three tabs: Blog page: Object expected on line 94; Portfolio: Same as before; Forums page: object expected on line 102.

And when you register for the forums, nothing happens when you click submit.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my preload
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

ive got my javascript one working, its not the javascript im having trouble with though, its the cookies. it works fdine in opera and safari but not on my IE6 becasue i think the cookies keep getting mixed with IE7

heres basically my code:

[php]

<?php if(preg_match('|Opera ([0-9].[0-9]{1,2})|',$_SERVER[HTTP_USER_AGENT],$cont)) { $browser_version=$cont[1]; $browser = 'Opera'; }elseif (preg_match('|MSIE ([0-9].[0-9]{1,2})|',$_SERVER[HTTP_USER_AGENT],$cont)) { $browser_version=$cont[1]; $browser = 'IE'; }elseif(preg_match('|Firefox/([0-9\.]+)|',$_SERVER[HTTP_USER_AGENT],$cont)) { $browser = 'Firefox'; $browser_version=$cont[1]; }elseif(preg_match('|Safari/([0-9\.]+)|',$_SERVER[HTTP_USER_AGENT],$cont)) { $browser = 'Safari'; $browser_version=$cont[1]; }else { $browser_version = '0'; $browser= '0'; } if($browser==IE && round($browser_version)>6) { setcookie(loaded, true); $compatible = true; } if($browser==Firefox && round($browser_version)>1) { setcookie(loaded, true); $compatible = true; } if(!$_COOKIE[loaded]) { if($view==preload && $_GET[load]) { setcookie(loaded, true); $view = Blog; }else { preload(); die; } ?>

[/php]

i dont see why the cookies shouldnt be working…

Read full topic
